caption: Friendliness and passion of service staff is off the charts! Drinks were strong but flavorful. We checked out mostly their tacos, so can’t speak to everything on their menu but flavors didn’t match some of the more traditional Mexican places in this area of 14th St. The blue corn tortillas were good and were unique. Seating is socially distant with 8-10 4 seater tables outdoor under a roof.
Amazing experience. What a gem. You must come visit and enjoy the great food, drinks, and service.

Wasn't terribly impressed. The menus veg options sounded very interesting like the Jamaican Hibiscus Taco but I was disappointed by everything I got. Worth mentioning that we got delivery and nothing was hot by the time it got to us. Perhaps at the restaurant it is much better since this place seems to be getting such good reviews.
The huevos rancheros was so yummy!

Actual Mexican food, done well in DC. I had the Pollo with the red mole, and my wife had an assortment of tacos. The mole was great, and the tacos were really good too.  Great blue corn tortillas!  Plus $5 margaritas on the brunch menu, you can’t beat that in DC.

Everyone go here now because this place is going to get real popular, real fast. IT'S AMAZING! Cocktails are on point, food is delicious, and the service is friendliest in all of DC, I swear. It's also incredibly affordable! This place has it all. Even the decor and plates are different and festive. I 🤍 DC Corazon! 💙❤️💛

Only go here if you want the best. The atmosphere and food are untouched. Amazing service all around, you can tell that the food is prepared with passion and the staff have the same energy. I went here once with my friends and I’ll be going back with my family.
Staff does a great job at creating an authentic Mexican (eating)experience and the food was delicious.
Fantastic spot for some authentic homemade Mexican food and wonderful service. Thank you to Josephine (sp?), JP, and Jose for bringing a wonderful bright spot to northern Columbia Heights!  ❤️

I got the Sopa Azteca (delicious!) and a couple of different tacos (tasty, generous portions, fantastic tortillas) a couple nights ago. I’m definitely going back and I look forward to trying their drinks.
Delicious food, attentive wait staff, beautiful paintings and decorations, and heated patio seating if you're interested in dining distanced outside. Looking forward to ordering again!

DC Corazon was a wonderful experience when I stopped by after a long week at work.  The atmosphere is relaxing and the staff is quite friendly.  I had delicious chicken quesadillas with tacos and also ordered enchiladas de mole for take out, which were still good for lunch the next day.  This is a good spot to stop for a drink or to enjoy a nice dinner.  I look forward to returning.

This place has fresh, tasty food, a cute and warm patio for outdoor dining and great spicy margaritas. Attentive servers, too. I’m so excited they opened up in our neighborhood - we’ll be back soon! Check them out!

First time visiting DC Corazon. Amazing experience!!!  Exactly what DC is missing. Best Mexican food I’ve had yet in the area.  I ordered the Pozole Blanco (Traditional Mexican Stew) Huevos Rancheros, the brunch special, Carne Asada Omelette with hongos (mushrooms) and Flan Al Mezcal (Caramel custard infused with Mezcal). Everyone I encountered was super friendly. Bartenders, Ari and Jose, are reasons alone to come back.  Love, love, love the interior art!  Compliments to the owner, Josefina, on truly a unique place.  I’ll return soon and recommend this place to anyone and everyone!
This restaurant has the BEST, most AUTHENTIC,  Delicious Mexican food! The staff is super nice, and welcoming! Definitely coming back!
The drinks were delicious, the food was authentic, and the service was above and beyond! I will be coming back here every time I visit DC.

I ordered from the lunch menu after Dc Corazon opened this week. I got the sopes and they added hongos (mushrooms) at my request. Also came with a side of beans and rice, and I also got tres leches cake (it was a heart but I dropped it on my way home). The sopes were very yummy and flavorful with peppers and some crunch on the base. The beans were actually amazing, somewhat smoky. And the cake was really good especially with the kiwi on top. Super cute spot and great prices. The owner said they would be updating and expanding the menu soon.
